correspAction.name: the Central Bureau of Agriculture of South Australia

head.supplied: [Baron Sir Frederick ¶ sic. ¶ von Mueller, K.C.M.G., &c., Victorian Government Botanist, Melbourne, has written requesting that the algae (seaweeds) of the South Australian coasts may be collected. M...

div.p: To the Central Bureau of Agriculture of South Australia

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from the Secretary's weekly report, in the report of the meeting of the Central Bureau of Agriculture held on 27 March 1893, Adelaide observer, 1 April 1893, p. 10.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: von Mueller, K.C.M.G., &c., Victorian Government Botanist, Melbourne, has written requesting that the algae (seaweeds) of the South Australian coasts may be collected. Miss J. L. Hussey,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See M to J. Agardh, 7 June 1893.

p.seg: of Port Elliot, has already forwarded a beautiful collection of the algae of Port Elliot, and one or two others in various parts have promised to help the Baron in this valuable work.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See also M to F. Krichauff, 23 January 1893.
